shell_initial_prompt.description: Fresh shell with zsh prompt (➜  vimfu)

shell_ls_with_files.description: Shell after ls showing two files

shell_cat_file.description: Shell after cat showing file contents

vim_launch_new_file.description: Vim launched with new (empty) file from shell

vim_launch_existing_file.description: Vim launched with existing file (2 lines)

vim_quit_dirty_e37.description: :q on dirty buffer shows E37+E162 multi-line error with "Press ENTER"

lines.text: E37: No write since last change
E162: No write since last change for buf
Press ENTER or type command to continue

textLines: E37: No write since last change
E162: No write since last change for buf
Press ENTER or type command to continue

vim_quit_dirty_e37_dismiss.description: After dismissing E37 prompt, back to normal vim

vim_q_clean_back_to_shell.description: :q on clean buffer returns to shell

vim_q_bang_back_to_shell.description: :q! on dirty buffer returns to shell without saving

vim_ZZ_saves_and_quits.description: ZZ saves and returns to shell

vim_ZQ_quits_without_saving.description: ZQ discards and returns to shell

roundtrip_create_reopen.description: File created with :wq, reopened from shell with data intact

shell_ls_after_vim_write.description: ls after vim :wq shows the file

vim_shell_escape_ls.description: :!ls shows file listing in shell_msg mode

lines.text: Press ENTER or type command to continue

textLines: Press ENTER or type command to continue

vim_shell_escape_ls_dismiss.description: After dismissing :!ls, back to normal vim

shell_set_o_vi.description: Shell after "set -o vi" enables vi-mode (prompt, insert mode)

shell_vi_type_and_escape.description: Vi-mode: typed "hello world" then Escape (cursor moves left, block cursor)

shell_vi_motion_0_dollar.description: Vi normal: 0 moves to start of line

shell_vi_motion_w.description: Vi normal: w moves to next word

shell_vi_motion_b.description: Vi normal: b moves to previous word start

shell_vi_x_delete.description: Vi normal: x deletes char under cursor

shell_vi_dw.description: Vi normal: dw deletes word + trailing space

shell_vi_cw.description: Vi normal: cw changes word (like ce), replaced "hello" with "Hi"

shell_vi_dd.description: Vi normal: dd clears entire line

shell_vi_f_semicolon_repeat.description: Vi normal: ft then ; repeats find

shell_vi_r_replace.description: Vi normal: rX replaces char under cursor with X

shell_vi_p_paste.description: Vi normal: x then p (delete a, paste after cursor)

shell_vi_I_insert_start.description: Vi: I inserts at start of line

shell_vi_A_append_end.description: Vi: A appends at end of line

shell_vi_tilde_swap_case.description: Vi normal: ~~~ swaps case of first 3 chars

shell_vi_C_change_to_end.description: Vi: C changes from cursor to end of line

shell_vi_D_delete_to_end.description: Vi: D deletes from cursor to end of line

shell_vi_cursor_shape_normal.description: Vi normal mode has block cursor

shell_vi_cursor_shape_insert.description: Vi insert mode has beam cursor

shell_vi_set_o_emacs.description: set -o emacs disables vi-mode, back to normal editing

shell_vi_enter_executes_from_normal.description: Enter in vi normal mode executes command

shell_vi_df_motion.description: Vi normal: dfd deletes from cursor through d (inclusive)

shell_vi_s_substitute.description: Vi: s substitutes char and enters insert mode

shell_vi_2p_count.description: Vi normal: 2p pastes yanked char twice

shell_vi_undo.description: Vi normal: u undoes last delete

shell_vi_undo_multiple.description: Vi normal: multiple u undoes multiple changes

shell_vi_dot_repeat_x.description: Vi normal: . repeats x three times

shell_vi_t_motion.description: Vi normal: to moves to one before first "o"

shell_vi_T_motion.description: Vi normal: T space from end moves after last space

shell_vi_dt_motion.description: Vi normal: dtd deletes up to (not including) d

shell_vi_ct_motion.description: Vi normal: ctd changes up to d, type XY

shell_vi_R_replace_mode.description: Vi: R overtypes chars, XY replaces ab

shell_vi_R_backspace_restores.description: Vi: R then Backspace restores original char

shell_vi_G_oldest_history.description: Vi normal: G jumps to oldest history entry

shell_vi_hash_comment.description: Vi normal: # comments out line and executes

shell_vi_r_count.description: Vi normal: 3rX replaces 3 chars with X

shell_vi_tilde_count.description: Vi normal: 3~ swaps case of 3 chars

shell_wc.description: wc shows line, word, byte counts

shell_grep_n_flag.description: grep -n shows line numbers with matches

shell_grep_c_flag.description: grep -c shows count of matching lines

shell_cp.description: cp copies file, cat shows the copy

shell_mv.description: mv moves file, cat shows moved content

vim_bang_wc.description: :!wc shows word count output in vim

lines.text: Press ENTER or type command to continue

textLines: Press ENTER or type command to continue

lines.text: Press ENTER or type command to continue

textLines: Press ENTER or type command to continue

lines.text: Press ENTER or type command to continue

textLines: Press ENTER or type command to continue

vim_read_file.description: :r extra.txt inserts below cursor (line 1), cursor on first inserted line

vim_read_file_line2.description: :r on line 2 inserts below line 2, cursor on first inserted line

vim_read_file_last_line.description: :r on last line inserts below, cursor on first inserted line

vim_read_no_filename.description: :r with no filename shows E32 error
